definition: Increase in muscle fiber size through progressive overload.
Gradual increase of resistance or volume to stimulate adaptation.
Consuming more calories than expended to promote muscle gain.
Light activity that aids recovery without complete inactivity.
Weeks 1–4: technique and mobility, base endurance with basic exercises.
Weeks 5–10: moderate overload with bodyweight and backpack to gain strength.
Weeks 11–18: high volume and 8–12 reps to maximize muscle growth.
Weeks 19–24: circuits and HIIT for definition and endurance.
